full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 613-2 Filed 02/24/22 Page 9 of 10 134 LBG8MAXVD1
1 THE COURT: Do you listen to the radio?
2 JUROR: I do not. I do listen to music, though.
3 THE COURT: What about podcasts?
4 JUROR: I do not.
5 THE COURT: Hobbies or things you do for fun?
6 JUROR: I love to travel and hang out with friends.
7 THE COURT: Have you ever followed a criminal case either on the news or podcasts or the like?
8 JUROR: I have not.
9 THE COURT: Any clubs or organizations to which you contribute time or money?
10 JUROR: I do not contribute to anything right now.
11 THE COURT: You have in the past?
12 JUROR: In college.
13 THE COURT: In these questions, I have tried to, of course, get a sense of whether you can be fair to both sides in this case. Any doubt about your ability to do that?
14 JUROR: No.
15 THE COURT: Other than what I have asked you, do you have any reason to think that you can't be fair and impartial here?
16 JUROR: I do not.
17 THE COURT: Counsel, any questions?
18 MS. POMERANTZ: No. Thank you.
19 MS. STERNHEIM: No. Thank you.
20 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
21 DOJ-OGR-00009106
